CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 27, 1946, p. 3, reads: "CIO Secretary - Miss Agnes Stokes of Covington Street recently became the first colored girl to be employed in international offices of the Congress of Industrial Organizations. She is secretary to Boyd L. Wilson, international representative, at the union headquarters in the Commonwealth Building.  Miss Stokes was employed at the instigation of Mr. Wilson and with the support of Philip Murray, president.  She will attend the international convention at Atlantic City, N.J., in May. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Agnes Stokes seated at typewriter in Congress of Industrial Organizations office, Commonwealth Building, Downtown
